intro: Bigelowia bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's bigelowia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It produces small, yellow to brown flowers that are often clustered in a spherical or conical shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
